step1.sentence: After closing three deals in one day, Sarah felt like she was on a roll and kept pushing through her call list.

step2.story: Marcus had aced his morning presentation and then landed a big client right after lunch. He was clearly on a roll, so his team let him lead the afternoon meeting too. By the end of the day, they had hit every target on their list.

step3.story: It started with a lucky free throw in the first quarter — then another, and another. By halftime, Jamie had scored eighteen points and the crowd was chanting his name. He was on a roll, and even the opposing coach called a timeout to break his momentum. Back on the court, Jamie felt unstoppable, reading every play a second before it happened. He finished the game with a career-high thirty-two points, grinning as his teammates mobbed him at the buzzer.

meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 연속으로 성공하거나 일이 잘 풀리는 상태를 묘사할 때 쓴다. 좋은 흐름이 계속 이어지고 있음을 강조한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 도박 용어에서 유래했으며, 주사위나 볼링공이 연속으로 유리하게 굴러가는 상황을 가리켰다. 20세기 초부터 일상적인 성공의 연속을 뜻하는 표현으로 확장되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 주로 긍정적이고 신이 난 어조로 쓰이며, 지금 이 순간의 흐름을 멈추지 말라는 뉘앙스도 담긴다. 스포츠, 업무, 게임 등 다양한 상황에서 자연스럽게 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Don't interrupt her — she's on a roll with her writing.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀 방해하지 마 — 지금 글쓰기가 잘 풀리고 있거든.
